required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Factors and Characteristics of Heart Rate Variability in Runners
clinical_study.official_title: Factors and Characteristics of Heart Rate Variability During Long Distance Running

lead_sponsor.agency: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

clinical_study.source: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to describe the variation characteristics and factors of the heart rate variability during long-distance running.

detailed_description.textblock: Heart rate variability is recognized as the indicator to measure the autonomic nerve activity. By monitoring the heart rate variability of runners during long-distance running, we could monitor the status of the runners' cardiovascular system and predict the exercise risk of runners during long-distance running.

primary_outcome.description: Subjects will be asked to wear a small monitoring equipment before,during and after a long distance running (over 3 km)， and complete the corresponding amount of exercise within a specified time during the test

arm_group.description: Subjects will be asked to wear a small monitoring equipment before,during and after a long distance running (over 3 km).

intervention.description: Complete a long distance running（over 3 km） within the specified time (30 minutes)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
People have below conditions could be included:
1. age is 18-60 years.
2. have normal ECG .
3. agree to participate in the study.
Exclusion Criteria:
People have below conditions will be excluded:
1. have known Congenital heart disease and rheumatic heart disease.
2. have known Hypertension and cerebrovascular disease.
3. have known Myocarditis and other heart diseases.
4. have known Coronary artery disease and severe arrhythmia.
5. have known Diabetes with high or low blood glucose.
6. have a cold within two weeks before the study.
7. have other diseases considered unsuitable for participants in this study.
-

overall_official.affiliation: Huazhong University of Science and Technology

reference.citation: Hua W, Zhang LF, Wu YF, Liu XQ, Guo DS, Zhou HL, Gou ZP, Zhao LC, Niu HX, Chen KP, Mai JZ, Chu LN, Zhang S. Incidence of sudden cardiac death in China: analysis of 4 regional populations. J Am Coll Cardiol. 2009 Sep 15;54(12):1110-8. doi: 10.1016/j.jacc.2009.06.016.
Iskandar EG, Thompson PD. Exercise-related sudden death due to an unusual coronary artery anomaly. Med Sci Sports Exerc. 2004 Feb;36(2):180-2.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Huazhong University of Science and Technology
